body:
I got a failure compiling boost 1.55.0 with gcc 5.4.0 (got hit by [this](https://bugs.freebsd.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=197594)). 
```
boost error: no matching function for call to ‘call_once
```
From the thread it seems that 1.56 is fine.

How does one blacklist a specific compiler/compiler version for a specific version of a package?
title: boost-1.55 compilation issue with gcc-5
